# Implementation Plan: Daily Life-Healing Suggestions (365-Day Journey)

**Branch**: `001-daily-suggestions` | **Date**: 2025-12-17 | **Spec**: [specs/001-daily-suggestions/spec.md](spec.md)
**Input**: Feature specification from `specs/001-daily-suggestions/spec.md`

**Note**: This plan is generated by the `/speckit.plan` command and is ready for Phase 0 research and Phase 1 design.

## Summary

Build a frontend-only web application that delivers one daily life-healing suggestion per calendar day over a 365-day journey. Messages are date-locked (calculated from a fixed startDate), displayed at 6:00 AM local device time, and curated to emotionally support and encourage female students. The app features a calm, soothing UI inspired by Sleep Cycle, respects accessibility standards (WCAG AA, reduced-motion), and deploys as a static site to Vercel with zero backend or database requirements. All 365 messages are pre-defined and stored as static JSON or a compiled array in the frontend bundle.

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: JavaScript (Node.js 18+) or TypeScript (recommended for maintainability)  
**Primary Dependencies**: Nuxt.js 3, Vue 3 (Composition API), Vuetify 3  
**Storage**: Static JSON file (messages.json) or compiled array bundled with frontend; no database or server-side storage  
**Testing**: Vitest (unit), Playwright (integration/e2e), Nuxt test utilities  
**Target Platform**: Web (mobile-first, responsive design); static hosting (Vercel, Netlify, or any CDN)  
**Project Type**: Frontend single-application (SPA) with static asset deployment  
**Performance Goals**: Initial load <3s on 4G (mid-range device); animations ≥500ms for perceived gentleness; JS bundle <200KB (gzipped)  
**Constraints**: Frontend-only (no backend API); offline-capable (all assets bundled); privacy-first (no analytics/tracking); deterministic date-based message delivery  
**Scale/Scope**: ~50 Vue components, ~365 messages, ~1M LOC total (typical Nuxt app with Vuetify); single-page app with minimal routing

## Constitution Check

*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*

### Requirements Verification

✅ **Privacy & No-Collection (NON-NEGOTIABLE)**: Confirmed. Spec FR-009 explicitly forbids user data collection. No analytics, tracking, or telemetry planned. Frontend-only architecture eliminates server-side data collection surface.

✅ **Deterministic Date-Locked Delivery (NON-NEGOTIABLE)**: Confirmed. Spec FR-001, FR-003, FR-004 enforce pure date-based message selection (no user control). Clarification Q1 resolved day 365+ behavior to completion screen (no message cycling that might imply unlimited re-access).

✅ **Frontend-Only Static Deployment (Vercel-ready)**: Confirmed. Spec FR-010 and technical context specify static build artifact. Nuxt 3 with `nuxi generate` produces static HTML/JS/CSS. No serverless functions or backend required.

✅ **Simplicity, Accessibility & UX**: Confirmed. Spec FR-005, FR-006, FR-007 mandate calm UI, `prefers-reduced-motion` support, and WCAG AA compliance. User Story P2 focused on emotional tone and minimal, uncluttered interface.

✅ **Maintainability, Testing & Versioning**: Confirmed. Constitution specifies Nuxt 3 + Vue 3 Composition API, ESLint/Prettier, unit + UI tests (FR-001 date logic, P2 emotional tone tests). Semantic versioning and feature-branch PR reviews mandated.

### Result
**Status**: ✅ **PASS** — No constitutional violations. Plan aligns with all five core principles.

├── checklists/
│   └── requirements.md          # Quality checklist
└── tasks.md                     # Phase 2 (to be generated by /speckit.tasks)

### Source Code (repository root)

```text
# Frontend-only single-page application
frontend/
├── src/
│   ├── app.vue                  # Root layout component
│   ├── components/              # Reusable Vue components
│   │   ├── MessageDisplay.vue   # Main message display area
│   │   ├── Header.vue           # Navigation/header (if needed)
│   │   ├── Footer.vue           # Footer (if needed)
│   │   └── ...                  # Other UI components
│   ├── layouts/
│   │   ├── default.vue          # Default layout
│   │   └── blank.vue            # Blank layout for edge states
│   ├── pages/
│   │   ├── index.vue            # Home page (shows daily message)
│   │   ├── coming-soon.vue      # "Coming Soon" state (before startDate)
│   │   └── completed.vue        # Completion screen (after day 365)
│   ├── composables/
│   │   ├── useMessageIndex.ts   # Date calculation, message selection
│   │   ├── useDateLock.ts       # Validate current date vs startDate
│   │   └── useAnimation.ts      # Smooth transitions, reduced-motion
│   ├── services/
│   │   └── messageService.ts    # Load and provide 365 messages
│   ├── assets/
│   │   ├── messages.json        # 365 pre-defined life suggestions
│   │   ├── styles/
│   │   │   ├── global.css       # Global styles (calm palette, typography)
│   │   │   └── themes.css       # Vuetify theme customization (soft colors)
│   │   └── images/              # Minimal imagery (optional)
│   ├── nuxt.config.ts           # Nuxt configuration (static generation, Vercel)
│   ├── tsconfig.json            # TypeScript configuration (if using TS)
│   └── middleware/
│       └── dateValidator.ts     # Validate device date on each request
├── tests/
│   ├── unit/
│   │   ├── services/
│   │   │   └── messageService.spec.ts
│   │   └── composables/
│   │       └── useMessageIndex.spec.ts
│   ├── integration/
│   │   ├── dateSelection.spec.ts        # Test message-date mapping
│   │   ├── dateTransitions.spec.ts      # Test 6:00 AM transitions
│   │   └── emotionalTone.spec.ts        # User feedback on UI feel
│   └── e2e/
│       ├── daily-message.spec.ts        # User journey: open app, see message
│       ├── edge-cases.spec.ts           # Edge state rendering
│       └── accessibility.spec.ts        # WCAG AA validation
├── public/
│   └── manifest.json            # Web app manifest (PWA-ready)
├── package.json                 # Dependencies, scripts, build config
├── .eslintrc.cjs                # ESLint config (linting)
├── .prettierrc.json             # Prettier config (code formatting)
├── vercel.json                  # Vercel deployment config
└── README.md                    # Project setup and deployment guide

# No backend, no database, no server code
```

**Structure Decision**: Single frontend application (Option 1 variant) optimized for static deployment to Vercel. All 365 messages bundled as static JSON. No backend API or database. Minimal routing (home, coming-soon, completed). Composables handle core logic (date selection, animation). Vuetify provides accessible component library for calm UI.

## Complexity Tracking

> **No constitutional violations. No extra-curricular complexity requiring justification.**

N/A — The architecture is minimal and fully justified by the feature requirements (frontend-only, static, privacy-first).
